title: @Riot, check my most recent player report.
body:
I have ~20 minutes worth of recorded gameplay that says the scumbag sivir I had on my team deserves a permant (ideally MAC/IP address) ban.

Please be a good surgeon and remove this proverbial cancer from your game's community. Please and thank you.

replies.body:
They may already have. The last person to report the player will get a notification of said summoner, not everyone who has will.

If you do encounter them again, and they are still very toxic, report them again. Reports do stack up over time, and though it generally doesn't stop the creation of a new account, it does make the player remake and level a new account, which can be frustrating.

Hope this helps :)

The boards isn't the place to do this
Try here my friend ----> https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us
I don't really care if they actually see this. Chances are a player this toxic will get flagged in a couple more games then they'll see my report.
Just ran into this player 26 days later. Did the exact same thing. wtf Riot
Riot don't do IP bans. Because that would make sense and would potentially stop them creating a new account and buying new skins.

They do it to pros and streamers to make an example out of them. Usually the ruling reads something like 'X player is banned/suspended for Y duration as are any know alternate accounts and any new accounts that we discover'.
